description: Great app with a clear and simple UI. Does the job well as it is said on the tin ! Looking forward for more advanced features (auto download of .torrent files from a folder, black / block lists management)
summary: Great app, simple and clear UI, missing a bit of advanced features

description: Downloads torrents and looks nice
This is a great torrent client but PLEASE add a system tray icon we can minimise too!

I really did want to like this. Transmission looks and feels its age, and I was looking for a smoother torrent client. Features like automatically detecting the magnet link in my clipboard were sexy enough to draw me in, at first. But it doesn't support infohashes, and that's enough to kill it for me. I'll come back with much jubilation once infohashes are supported.
summary: Looks good, works well, missing essential feature

description: A really simple, good-looking and native GTK+ app. Has everything you actually need from a torrent client without all those bells and whistles.
Simple, elegant, and minimal torrent client is really all anyone needs.
summary: A CSD GTK+ app Torrent Client Worth Checking Out

description: It's a great looking client and displays info in a comfortable manner; however, it lacks some functionalities like switching file location and such.
Simple, yet powerful application. Perfectly polished.
For example, you can't choose which files you'd like to download.
Needs Proxy, and/or Socks 5 setting in my opinion.
Works fine and really should be included by default.
awesome! love the CSD design + simplicity. works with magnet links too. Probably the best GTK torrent app!
Important feature needed: Ability for select files an their priority
summary: For now seems to be okay but..

description: No option to choose which files to download, no way to order downloads by importance/priority(queue), no way to download sequentially.
If you want a simple BitTorrent client, this one is a good option.
This is an absolutely beautifully simple app. All it is missing for me is an indicator and a bandwidth throttling switch. It's also not opening files.

Simple, does one job and does it well.

Awesomeeeeee
The app suddenly closes itself before completing the transfer leaving me with an .part file in my downloads folder.
summary: Great interface, but closes before finishing the download

description: Clean and simple torrent client. It just needs to allow you to select which files you want to download from a torrent.
Clean and simple interface, does exactly what its meant to do.
This client does what it's supposed to, and not a lot more. I would like to see some basic configuration editor built in, in stead of having to go through the settings.json file with a text editor
Very nice looking and minimalist app. Haven't got any problem so far, except write permission to a secondary HDD under ubuntu 20.04.1. Used flatseal to fix that. Keep doing good job and thank's!

This is the most beautiful, neat looking, covienient torrent client I've used. The only (minor) problem I have encoutered is the icon doesn't seen to display properly, so I edited the icon path. But I still love it. 5/5.
Although I can't use it while it doesn't let me pick individual files on torrents
I would however like to have the option to not upload anything.

While good looking, lacks some important features as the ability to download each file to a different place. If you like video files going to a Videos directory while the iso files go to an Isos directory, so you can keep seeding while maitainig your machine organized, you wont get it here. I also doesn't allow you to pick which specific files to download from a torrent.
For gnome desktop it is a typical gnome app, functional and well designed

Não chega a ser o melhor, mas funciona bem. Falta opções de adicionar o torrent em um local ou usar um magnet link. Também existe uma falta de informações do torrent sendo baixado, como arquivos e incluindo seleção do que se deseja baixar, de onde esta vindo os seeders e leechers e servidores.

Outro ponto faltoso é com relação ao flatpak que não te permite escolher um armazenamento esterno sem adicionar o argumento --filesystem. Mas isso não tem haver com o programa em sí.

The lack of an ability to specify a port (e.g. as one can do in Transmission) makes this app incompatible with certain networks and VPNs (e.g. Mullvad). This makes it impossible to seed torrents using Fragments under many conditions.
summary: No way to specify port for torrents

description: A pure garbage. Just use transmission.
Amazing torrent client. It is very easy to use and it looks like a native GNOME app!

It's good enough for me.
Load times are really slow (20s) though.
Missing several key features you'd expect from a torrent client but looks beautiful and has the basics right
summary: Simple but missing many key features

description: One huge drawback that made this useless for me was that I could not select any other download location other than my local drive, which in my case was say to small for downloading. It couldn't even see my USB.
summary: Has promise, great look, easy to use, no options

description: THESE APP DOWNLOAD THE MY GARUDA LUNIX ISO FAST THAN CHROME DOWNLOAD.??????️?️

It's clean and modern, looks great, feels slick, and in a good position to be the best Gnome DE torrent tool, if only they would add *essential* QoL features, that I'm sure others have mentioned, and anyone who's used any other torrent application will notice the missing ones here. File management, individual torrent set location, etc etc etc.
summary: Clean, modern, but desperately lacking features

description: Has a beautiful UI (fits Gnome) but not being able to select files inside a torrent (lets say you want to download few episodes instead of the whole season) makes this app useless to me. I'm gonna stick to Transmission instead.
summary: Good UI, lack of important features

description: Super clean app that just works!

If you torrent occasionally then this is a good alternative to Transmission. I'd rate it higher, but the lack of dark-mode and the UI's inability to scale/fit the active torrent's tab properly with the window, lands Fragments on a solid 3/5. I expect these issues will be addressed in the future.

- Lack of dark mode
- Slow startup time

I can cope with the lack of dark mode now but I hope it'll be implemented by the time GNOME 42 lands. The slow startup time is painful and a pretty big deal.
summary: Good but not quite there yet for me

description: The application looks gorgeous and has all the functionality needed.
The latest update destroyed this app. I use Fragment on multiple systems. They are all broken. I hope this changes.

Nice little app but without darkmode support I can't give it more than 2 stars...
I would be very happy to give 5 stars once a darkmode support will be available !

Integrates really well with gnome 42. The dark mode look amazing. Perfect torrent app to download the occasional torrent. However if you torrent a lot I would recommend you use something like deluge or qbittorent
A really great app written with libadwaita. Looks beautiful and performs great!
summary: Simple and intuitive! I really like the GTK4 / libadwaita migration!

description: I have had so many issues downloading torrents which Fragments have fixed. Many of my torrent used to take days or even fail after waiting an issue which Fragment has permanently fixed. Thank you Fragment Team.

description: Nice UI does what it should.

I liked this app, but as Sanp the fornt is not clear to read

This should be the default torrent client of the Gnome. Aside from the fact that it does not respect the theme and the open in folder option does not works. This is the Best torrent client i have ever scene. you do not have to deal with too many options.
this is good so far, ive noticed its been on linux and i thought id give it a try so far so good and its even better in dark mode, thank you for this really great app.

I know the program is supposed to be simple and straight-to-the-point, but it does not have something that is important (for me), and that I consider to be a basic feature: the option to select which files to download in a torrent. Other than that, the program works flawlessly (although on the first start-up it said "failed to connect to network", but just closing and reopening the app solved it).
summary: Simples, easy to use, fast and integrates well with the system

description: Extremely simple, lacks a lot of options that you might need like limiting upload and download speed, and the ability to choose what folder to download you file to, howeer if all you need is to download torrents and only that, it works doesn't crash.

This is a lovely app (though I do know others have complained about dark mode; I use a light theme, so I can't speak to that). So that's nice. Nice and clean.

That said, the inability to set individual download locations for individual torrents or to only download specific files from torrents means that if you need those features, you have to have another client installed, and at that point, why do you need Fragments? 

I want to like it, so if those two features are ever implemented, I'll have to give it another go.
summary: Simple and simplistic are not the same thing

description: Open directory doesn't work. No way to limit network. When someone says it just keep crashing, they don't lie. It's true. Just installed, opened, then. . oops we are sorry fragment crashed. . . wow. . just wow

Hardware: 11th gen i7, Nvidia 3000 series GPU. 

And no, it's not an nvidia issue because it should be using igpu/prime render offloading.

Works well and looks good also!

I had problems with this application in the beginning. It is very transparent. It does not have unnecessary features that obscure functionality.
Does everything I need, has got useful settings and is really well put together overall.
A really nice and clean torrent client for the GNOME desktop, but very limited.
I was surprised with this app and taken away from the usual ones - keeping it all under the GNOME core and less bulk on my desktop
Simple, easy and beautifull.

Best gnome torrent client
nice looking and usefull
Crushes literally every single minute on Fedora 39 (flatpack)
Good. But there is one not good thing. You can't choose which files to download

I have been using this torrent client for 4 months and what can I say:
1. It doesn't connect to the ports. Other torrent clients can join the port, but Fragments strongly refuses to do so.
2. After 10 seconds of it starting to download, it stops because "Couldnt get /path/to/torrent". Most importantly, if you click to start the torrent again, it will also download for 10 seconds (with speed) and then it will stop again for the same reason. Perhaps this is due to the use of Cyrillic characters when downloading the torrent, or hard brackets. I haven't noticed this on other torrents except sometimes 3 or two where there were also either Cyrillic or hard brackets.
3. Very few settings. It would be better if there were few settings, but at the same time, there were the most important settings. Some very important settings like DHT or protocols are not in the settings.
The torrent client itself is unremarkable from others except for GTK theme support. I can not highlight any special advantages, because it has all the same features that are in other torrent clients, and I realized that after three months I'm moving to another torrent client. Undoubtedly, the torrent client is minimalistic and stylish, but still quite raw.
I'm not the same Yuri btw

In Ubuntu 23.10 the app takes 10 seconds to load the list of torrents (both with the list empty and the list contains some torrents)

Apart from this it has the best interface (extremely minimal) among p2p software

Very simple torrent client, works very good!
Not a whole lot of settings, though.
Arch Linux Magnet-Link wurde korrekt geöffnet, jedoch wurden keine Peers gefunden und es gab keinen Hinweis warum. Da hilft auch das gute Aussehen nichts.

Si sos un power user, necesitas definir donde va cada descarga y otras opciones avanzadas como control de ancho de banda, etc, este no es tu cliente, usa Transmision.
Si sos un usuario que no entiende mucho y solo necesita bajar de vez en cuando algo: Este si es tu cliente!.
summary: Super facil de usar, no para power users

description: anda bien, permite descargar torrent y magnet, limitar un maximo de descarga paralelas, solo le hace falta algunas opciones como limite de velocidad (global e individual), pero aún así sigue los conceptos de gnome estandar, no hay area de notificación, tiene estilo de ventana correcto, funciona bien si quieres descargar algo cada tanto la verdad muy bonito, lo recomiendo, pero si requieres muchas descargas algo mas avanzado usa transmission o bitTorrent
summary: Esta bien, aunque le falta un poco

description: La acabo de probar en su versión 2.0 con el toque GTK4 y GNOME Libadwaita: una apli *preciosa*. Muy sencilla e ideal para cualquiera. Solo se echa en falta el tema de limites de velocidad (global e individual) pero, en mi caso, no impide que está apli sea mi elección. Maravilloso trabajo, felicidades.
summary: Una apli BitTorrent bonita, fácil y completa

description: Ya era la mejor aplicación de torrents, pero con la última versión con el nuevo rediseño ahora lo es más

description: Se crashea apenas empieza a descargar algo, pero se ve muy bonita y simple de usar.
Es una buena aplicación para descargar torrents, pero el problema es que la versión en rpm ( fedora ) se crashea, recomiendo instalarla en flatpak ya que en ese formato no presenta ningún problema.
Un cliente torrent fácil y simple.
Très bonne intégration avec le bureau GNOME par son design, et fonctionne très bien

L'application a l'air cool mais inutilisable en l'état actuel puisqu'on ne peut même pas sélectionner les fichiers qu'on souhaite télécharger.
Etant donné qu'il n'y a pas eu de mise à jour depuis plus d'un an, je doute que son développement ne soit pas abandonné: dommage.
il manque l'option pour bloquer des adresses IP. À force d'être trop minimaliste, gnome se tire une balle dans le pied avec la sur-simplification.
Отличный минималистичный клиент, выполненный в соответствии с Gnome Style Guide. На момент написания отзыва не хватает некоторых фич вроде последовательной или выборочной загрузки.

Очень хорошее приложение, искал именно такой торрент-клиент, очень удобен в использовании, но поддержу предыдущего оратора - пришлось уйти с него из-за того, что отсутствуют такие фичи, как выборочная загрузка файлов (далеко не все торренты имеет смысл качать целиком). Буду следить за разработкой, автору - удачи)
